instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.PM_SLP_S4_L: What is PM_SLP_S4_L? PM_SLP_S4_L is a signal that puts the system into an S4 suspend to disk sleep state when it is low(_L means signal is asserted when voltage is low).
definitions.PM_DSW_PWRGD: What is PM_DSW_PWRGD? The "PM_DSW_PWRGD" signal in a MacBook stands for "Deep Sleep Well Power Good‚Äù and is required for the machine to power on & post..

threads.title: <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL> hell
threads.message:
ok. I have multiple boards with this problem.
is this common?
Does the PCH in the CPU really die all the time?

Looking for feed back from those that have been there.

threads.title: <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL> hell
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL> must rise to 3V only after power button is pressed, or when charger is connected.
PCH requires presence of other signals before release this signal.

threads.title: <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL> hell
threads.message:
Yes, and other more.
We discussed many times the power on sequence on the forum...

threads.title: <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL> hell
threads.message: <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL> can be anything and everything. HISTORY aid the board is so important. If liquid, the hints should be there in front of you. If drop, done for. If no liquid and super clean, visual inspection and if nothing, trash. Most of the time, <SIGNAL>PM_SLP</SIGNAL> is missing due to liquid. Not always a dead CPU

threads.title: <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL> hell
threads.message:
You can start posting any voltage which you think is related in this case.
We comment after that.
Usually all these signals appear connected to RTC and System Power Management blocks of PCH.

threads.title: <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL> hell
threads.message: This board had a CPU problem.  It is now a member of my donor pile.  I hope to be able to replace CPUs soon.
